thread.title: Prep roundup: Burlington Central girls volleyball rolls on road
thread.title_full: Prep roundup: Burlington Central girls volleyball rolls on road

title: Prep roundup: Burlington Central girls volleyball rolls on road
text:
Prep roundup: Burlington Central girls volleyball rolls on road Published: Thursday, Oct. 15, 2015 10:56 p.m. CDT • Updated: Friday, Oct. 16, 2015 12:33 a.m. CDT By KANE COUNTY CHRONICLE 
JOHNSBURG – Buoyed by what co-coach Meghan Blahnik dubbed “our best defense all season,” the Burlington Central girls volleyball team swept Johnsburg, 25-20, 25-11, on Thursday. 
BC (25-3, 12-0 Big Northern Conference East) maintained its one-game conference lead on Genoa-Kingston with the victory. 
“We played really, really well tonight,” Blahnik said. “Johnsburg put up a fight, so it was nice for us to step up to that challenge. We’re doing good and we’re battling illnesses right now, so we’re fighting along.” 
Lexi DeWaard had 16 assists and eight digs for Central, while Rachel Gaydos had 10 digs. Leah Murphy (seven kills) and Kendall Boron (six kills, four blocks) paced the attack. 
BC has two conference matches remaining, visiting Harvard on Tuesday before traveling to Genoa-Kingston on Oct. 22. 
The Rockets handed the Cogs their lone league loss to date on Sept. 29, prevailing in three sets, 
Kaneland def. Morris, 2-1 (26-24, 23-25, 26-24): At Morris, Kaneland erased a 19-11 deficit in the first set en route to improving to 16-11 (3-4 Northern Illinois Big 12 East). Knights coach Cyndi Violett said Alex Anderson “blocked tremendously well” in the victory. 
Rosary def. Resurrection, 2-0 (25-7, 26-24): At Aurora, Kennedy Jenig served four aces for Rosary in the opening set. 
BOYS SOCCER 
Batavia 1, Geneva 1: At Batavia, the Bulldogs finished at 1-2-3 in the Upstate Eight Conference River Division. 
Geneva went 0-4-2 in River play. 
Yorkville 3, Kaneland 1: At Maple Park, Kaneland senior Triston Powell scored in the 74th minute to prevent the Knights (8-7-4, 4-2-2 NI Big 12) from suffering a shutout in their regular-season finale. 
Wheaton Academy 4, Marmion 1: At Aurora, Marmion fell to Wheaton Academy in a nonconference matchup, as the Cadets (9-7-3) dropped their second straight home match after not losing at home for three years. Marmion trailed, 1-0, at halftime. 
GIRLS SWIMMING 
St. Charles East 95, Benet 73: At St. Charles, East’s individual winners included Kayla Jones in the 200-yard freestyle (2:01.86), Anna O’Malley in the 200 individual medley (2:17.63) and diver Molly Moss, who edged teammate Courtney Green, 167.85 to 167.45.
